alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Alleghany and northwestern Surry Counties in northwestern North Carolina, southwestern Carroll and southeastern Grayson Counties in southwestern Virginia and the City of Galax through 545 PM EDT... At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Barrett, or near Mountain Park, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall and cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding in poor drainage and low-lying areas. Ponding of water on roadways and highways. Locations impacted include... Galax... Hillsville... Fancy Gap... Ennice... Mountain Park... Bottom... and Cana. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
